org.attoparser.select

Interface ISelectionAwareMarkupHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IMarkupHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AttributeMarkingSelectedMarkupHandler

    public interface ISelectionAwareMarkupHandler
extends IMarkupHandler

    Specialization of the IMarkupHandler interface that allows a handler to receive information from the BlockSelectorMarkupHandler and NodeSelectorMarkupHandler handler implementations about what selectors are active for a specific event.

    This enables the handler to take specific actions depending on the selectors that are currently matching the received events.

    An example implementation of this interface is AttributeMarkingSelectedMarkupHandler, which uses the information received through this interface's methods to add a certain attribute to markup elements that explain why (by means of what selector) they were selected.

    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Fernández

    • Method Detail

      • setSelectors

        void setSelectors(String[] selectors)

        Specifies the selectors that are going to be checked by the previous handler (normally a BlockSelectorMarkupHandler or a NodeSelectorMarkupHandler implementation).

        This method passes all the available selectors, and is only called once during parsing, before any other event handler is called.

        Note the specified array should not be modified in any form, as this could have undesirable effects.

        Parameters:
        selectors - the selectors that are going to be used for matching.

      • setCurrentSelection

        void setCurrentSelection(boolean[] currentSelection)

        Specifies the selectors that will match the following events, according to the previous handler (normally a BlockSelectorMarkupHandler or a NodeSelectorMarkupHandler implementation).

        This method will be called before the event handling methods that correspond with matches in one or several of the established selectors, so that the event handlers of these selectors can use that information.

        For example, if an <img> tag matches a "//li" selector, this setCurrentSelection(boolean[]) method will be called before the corresponding IMarkupHandler.handleStandaloneElementStart(char[], int, int, boolean, int, int) specifying that "//li" is now matched. Also, after IMarkupHandler.handleStandaloneElementEnd(char[], int, int, boolean, int, int) has been called, setCurrentSelection(boolean[]) will be called again with a null argument in order to reset the current selection flags.

        Parameters:
        currentSelection - the current selection, i.e. the selectors that now match. This is specified as a boolean[] referencing the String[] previously specified in setSelectors(String[]), with each position being true if that selector matches, or false if not.
